text:
When I was younger,
of course I had dreams

like being a boxer
when I discovered Rocky Balboa.

I'm Jeremy Picosson,
I come from France

and I'm currently working
at Jimmy Energy,
a French start-up that aims to design
and operate a small nuclear reactor.

I'm in charge
of the scientific simulation,

so I'm here to deliver
an infrastructure

for calculation
for my simulation team
and software deployment.

If we want to achieve
the global goals

of reducing carbon footprint,
we really believe
that nuclear is the key.

A lot of focus is put
on electricity decarbonization

so we came
with this type of technology

that can really help
to produce high temperatures.

We kind of created a new path
in the nuclear industry
in order to have stability.

We went cloud-native in our approach
for the simulation aspect.
AWS came on board.

We knew that it was
the cloud provider
with more developed HPC tools

and we wanted IT solutions
that are easy to use,

easy to implement,
that you can gradually complexify.

AWS service
was really great for that.
My hope for the future

is that we have a successful
first landing of our product.
I really think our product is key

for fighting against
the climate crisis.

We hope to convince
a lot more industries
to trust in our solution

and together, I really think
we can achieve something huge
for France, then I hope, Europe
and who knows, maybe the world.
